meanings.definition: The act of washing oneself, often as a religious ritual.
meanings.sent1: After the ceremony, the priest performed the ablution to cleanse himself.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, she performs her ablution before starting her day.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, the ablution ritual was accompanied by joyful singing.
meanings.sent4: The ablution of the soul can bring a sense of peace and renewal.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the flowing water during the ablution was soothing and calming.

meanings.definition: The act of washing a part of the body, such as the hands or face.
meanings.sent1: He quickly did an ablution of his hands before sitting down to eat.
meanings.sent2: The nurse assisted the patient in performing a gentle ablution of her face.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's ablution of his hands turned into a playful water fight.
meanings.sent4: Her ablution of her face revealed a refreshed and radiant complexion.
meanings.sent5: The ablution of his hands in the cool stream was refreshing on a hot day.

meanings.definition: The act of cleansing or purifying something.
meanings.sent1: The ablution of the sacred statue was performed with great care and reverence.
meanings.sent2: The traditional ceremony included an ablution of the ceremonial sword.
meanings.sent3: The ablution of the ancient artifact revealed intricate carvings hidden beneath the dirt.
meanings.sent4: The ritualistic ablution of the temple symbolized the renewal of spiritual energy.
meanings.sent5: The ablution of the crystal brought out its dazzling clarity and brilliance.
